Package refactor.message

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • refactor.message.Message
  • public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a Message that is sent between nodes of the network utilizing this protocol. It has metadata and can have optional data, for when it is needed. Messages with no data are assumed to be protocol control messages
    Since:
    20.06.2019
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Filipe Medeiros - filipesilvamedeiros@gmail.com, Filipe Medeiros - github.com/filipesmedeiros

        private static final java.lang.String BAD_ARGUMENT_DESTINATION
        Helper exception message for when the provided destination is empty, is null or is unresolved
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • metadata

        private MessageMetadata metadata
        This field stores all metadata associated with a message, either it is specific of general. This object should provide a fast way to get a specific field of metadata, and also an efficient way to encode the metadata into a ByteBuffer

      • data

        private java.nio.ByteBuffer data
        If the message has any data (client application data), it will be stored here

      • destination

        private java.net.InetSocketAddress destination
        This field is used within the program for the various layers of the protocol to communicate between each other. It is not sent in the encoded message

    • Constructor Detail

      • Message

        public Message​(MessageDecoder.MessageType messageType)
        Default constructor for the Message class. Constructs a Message with the given type, and no data or any other metadata
        Parameters:
        messageType - This determines the type of this message (prune, join, etc.)

    • Method Detail

      • sizeInBytes

        public int sizeInBytes()
        Size of this Message in bytes. Includes: type, number of metadata entries for decoding, the metadata entries, and the data present (if any), plus its size in bytes
        Returns:
        The size of this Message in bytes

      • encode

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer encode()
                           throws MessageTooLargeException
        Encodes the whole Message into a ByteBuffer, including metadata and data, if any. Will be mostly used to send this Message to other nodes in the network
        Returns:
        The encoded ByteBuffer with all this Message's information
        Throws:
        MessageTooLargeException - If the Message, in bytes, is larger than the defined limit in GlobalSettings

      • messageType

        public MessageDecoder.MessageType messageType()
        Simply returns this Message's type. The possible types are defined in MessageDecoder
        Returns:
        This Message's type

      • metadata

        public MessageMetadata metadata()
        Simply returns this Message's metadata object. It contains all entries currently defined, plus some more info and any alterations in this map will also be made in the original one, so use with caution
        Returns:
        A reference to this Message's metadata

      • metadataEntry

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer metadataEntry​(java.lang.String label)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets a specific entry of the metadata of this Message, in the form of a ByteBuffer, given its label, or null if an entry with the given label is not found
        Parameters:
        label - The label of the entry to get
        Returns:
        The value of the requested metadata entry
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the label passed is either null or empty

      • addMetadataEntry

        public void addMetadataEntry​(java.lang.String label,
                             java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a new metadata entry to this Message's metadata, with a given label and value
        Parameters:
        label - The label to give to the metadata entry
        data - The value of the new metadata entry
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either the label or the data don't meet the standard requirements (which means one of them is null or empty of the label's length is incorrect

      • setData

        public Message setData​(java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        Set this message's data, in the form of a ByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to store in this message
        Returns:
        This message, for convenience purposes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the passed ByteBuffer is null or has no data in it ({@link Buffer#capacity()} == 0)

      • data

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer data()
        This method returns the data stored in the message. If the message doesn't contain any data (for example, a control message), this method returns null
        Returns:
        The ByteBuffer containing all the message data, or null if no data exists

      • setDestination

        public Message setDestination​(java.net.InetSocketAddress destination)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        A simple setter method for this Message's destination, that returns this object, for convenience purposes
        Parameters:
        destination - The destination of this Message (where it will be sent to)
        Returns:
        This Message, for convenience purposes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the passed InetSocketAddress is either null or unresolved (given by InetSocketAddress's isUnresolved()

      • getDestination

        public java.net.InetSocketAddress getDestination()
        Simple getter method to have access to this Message's destination
        Returns:
        This Message's destination, in the form of an InetSocketAddress

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object other)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
